component.name: websocket
component.title: Jetty Websocket
component.description: The websocket component provides websocket endpoints with Jetty for communicating with clients using websocket.
component.label: websocket

host.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0

port.description: The port number. The default value is 9292

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

staticResources.label: consumer
staticResources.description: Set a resource path for static resources (such as .html files etc). The resources can be loaded from classpath, if you prefix with classpath:, otherwise the resources is loaded from file system or from JAR files. For example to load from root classpath use classpath:., or classpath:WEB-INF/static If not configured (eg null) then no static resource is in use.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

enableJmx.label: advanced
enableJmx.description: If this option is true, Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

maxThreads.label: advanced
maxThreads.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for maxThreads is 1 2 noCores.

minThreads.label: advanced
minThreads.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for minThreads is 1.

threadPool.label: advanced
threadPool.description: To use a custom thread pool for the server. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9.

sslKeyPassword.label: security
sslKeyPassword.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

host.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

port.description: The port number. The default value is 9292. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

resourceUri.description: Name of the websocket channel to use

maxBinaryMessageSize.description: Can be used to set the size in bytes that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing. (Default is -1 - or unlimited)

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

sessionSupport.label: consumer
sessionSupport.description: Whether to enable session support which enables HttpSession for each http request.

staticResources.label: consumer
staticResources.description: Set a resource path for static resources (such as .html files etc). The resources can be loaded from classpath, if you prefix with classpath:, otherwise the resources is loaded from file system or from JAR files. For example to load from root classpath use classpath:., or classpath:WEB-INF/static If not configured (eg null) then no static resource is in use.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

sendTimeout.label: producer
sendTimeout.description: Timeout in millis when sending to a websocket channel. The default timeout is 30000 (30 seconds).

sendToAll.label: producer
sendToAll.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure on endpoint level, instead of having to use the WebsocketConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message.

basicPropertyBinding.label: advanced
basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

bufferSize.label: advanced
bufferSize.description: Set the buffer size of the websocketServlet, which is also the max frame byte size (default 8192)

maxIdleTime.label: advanced
maxIdleTime.description: Set the time in ms that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be idle before closing. (default is 300000)

maxTextMessageSize.label: advanced
maxTextMessageSize.description: Can be used to set the size in characters that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing.

minVersion.label: advanced
minVersion.description: Can be used to set the minimum protocol version accepted for the websocketServlet. (Default 13 - the RFC6455 version)

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

allowedOrigins.label: cors
allowedOrigins.description: The CORS allowed origins. Use to allow all.

enableJmx.label: monitoring
enableJmx.description: If this option is true, Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.
